definition: conscientious/earnest/serious/to take seriously/to take to heart

sentences.english: China stands ready to earnestly implement the agreement together with Vietnam.
sentences.chinese: 中方願與越方共同努力，認真落實協議。
老闆喜歡認真工作的員工。

sentences.english: Pharmacologist is seriously studying the hypersusceptibility reaction of this medicine.
sentences.chinese: 藥理學家們正在認真研究這種藥的過敏反應。

sentences.english: Then he sat down next to Voisin and began to write, carefully, without hurry, a thin legible hand.
sentences.chinese: 他不慌不忙，認認真真地寫下一串纖細而清晰的字跡。

sentences.english: You do not so serious to me, I'm afraid I will betray you.
sentences.chinese: 請你別對我那麼認真，只怕我會背叛你。

sentences.english: And when it was made plain who Kino was, the doctor grew stern and judicious at the same time.
sentences.chinese: 弄清楚誰是吉納後，醫生變得嚴肅認真而又明智起來。

sentences.english: Up. He was still smiling, but his ocher eyes were serious.
sentences.chinese: 他還是微笑着，但他黑金色的眸子顯得很認真。

sentences.english: His family was very poor, but he worked hard at his studies even in early childhood.
sentences.chinese: 孔子的家裏很窮，但是他從小就認真讀書，刻苦學習。

sentences.english: And I mean this literally, because the Yule Ball is, first and foremost a dance.
sentences.chinese: 而我是認真的，因爲聖誕舞會是最重要的舞會。

sentences.english: She opened her never-before-used set of watercolours and set to work.
sentences.chinese: 她打開自己從未用過的水彩畫工具，開始認真畫畫。

sentences.english: Third, after-school careful review, the consolidation of the knowledge the teacher said on the day.
sentences.chinese: 第三，課後認真複習，鞏固當天老師講過地知識。

sentences.english: I have listened closely to your concerns.
sentences.chinese: 我認真聽取了你們的關注。

sentences.english: Students read texts loudly and clearly in class.
sentences.chinese: 課堂上同學們很認真地朗聲讀課文。

sentences.english: No, it's not gonna work this time. Stop it. I'm serious, Boog.
sentences.chinese: 不行，這次不管用了停下來，我是認真的，博格。

sentences.english: The United States, according to Hormats, should listen to and carefully consider input from emerging economies.
sentences.chinese: 霍馬茨說，美國應傾聽並認真考慮新興經濟體的意見。

sentences.english: He seriously debated whether or not he should charge his tenants extra for the water.
sentences.chinese: 他認真地考慮該不該向房客們收取額外的水費。

definition: only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
to continue/to proceed with/to go on with
important point/main point/focus/key (project etc)/to focus on/to put the emphasis on
to recount (e.g. results of election)/to re-evaluate
